info.title: Timetable API
info.description: API documentation for the Timetable application

post.description: Generates a new timetable based on user preferences using advanced genetic algorithm optimization. Supports activity types (Lecture/Tutorial/Lab), tied sections, lecturer preferences, time constraints, and two optimization modes.

422.description: Validation error or no valid sections found

500.description: Internal server error - Timetable generation engine failure

get.description: Retrieves the currently active generated timetable for the authenticated user. Each user can have only one active timetable at a time.

404.description: No active timetable found for this user

delete.description: Deletes a record and returns no content

get.description: Returns available subjects and lecturers for timetable preferences
Get a list of all available course sections, with optional search functionality.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search term to filter sections by subject name, code, lecturer, or section number.

post.description: Create a new course section. Requires admin privileges.

get.description: Retrieve detailed information for a specific section.

put.description: Update an existing course section. Requires admin privileges.

delete.description: Delete a course section. Requires admin privileges.

get.description: Returns a key-value pair of all settings

delete.description: Deletes a record and returns no content

get.summary: Get list of timetable change requests (Admin only)
get.description: Returns list of timetable change requests

get.summary: Get change request information (Admin or owner)

delete.description: Deletes a record and returns no content

get.summary: Get list of timetables for the authenticated user

delete.description: Deletes a record and returns no content

post.summary: Store or update user's timetable preferences
post.description: Returns the created or updated preference data

get.summary: Get available options for timetable preferences
get.description: Returns available subjects, days, time slots, and lecturers

post.summary: Add a section to a timetable

section_id.description: ID of the section to add

delete.summary: Remove a section from a timetable

parameters.name: section
parameters.description: ID of the section to remove

GeneratedTimetable.title: Generated Timetable
GeneratedTimetable.description: A user's generated timetable containing optimized class schedules

user_id.description: ID of the user who owns this timetable

active.description: Whether this is the user's currently active timetable

TimetableData.title: Timetable Data
TimetableData.description: The structured timetable data generated by the optimization engine

GeneratedTimetableEntry.title: Generated Timetable Entry
GeneratedTimetableEntry.description: A single class entry in the generated timetable

tied_to.description: Related sections that must be taken together

TimetableGenerationRequest.title: Timetable Generation Request
TimetableGenerationRequest.description: Request payload for generating a new timetable

subjects.description: Array of subject IDs to include in the timetable

days.description: Array of day IDs indicating preferred days

enforce_ties.description: Whether to enforce tied sections (lecture-tutorial pairs)

lecturers.description: Optional array of preferred lecturer IDs

description.example: An introductory subject on programming fundamentals.

preferences.description: A key-value object of user preferences for timetable generation.

Section.title: Section
Section.description: A course section with activity type and tied relationships.

day_of_week.description: Day of the week for the class

tied_to.description: Array of section numbers that must be taken together
